newsitem.title: USA: Central and South West unit sells securities.
newsitem.headline: Central and South West unit sells securities.

text.p: Central and South West Corp said on Friday that its subsidiary, Central Power and Light Co, had sold $150 million of 8.00 percent cumulative quarterly income preferred securities Series A, due April 30, 2037.

The proceeds from the sale will be used by CPL to repay short-term debt, to provide working capital, and to reimburse CPL's treasury for the cost of reacquiring about $87.5 million aggregate par value of four series of preferred stock.
The securities were sold to underwriters in a negotiated offering and are rated baa1 by Moody's Investors Service, A- by Standard and Poor's Ratings Group and BBB+ by Duff & Phelps Credit Rating Co.
The securities are callable at par on or after April 30, 2002, Central and South West said in a statement. Settlement of the transaction will occur on May 14, it added.
Goldman, Sachs & Co is the lead manager for the offering, the company said.
Central and South West Corp is public utility holding company.
